usefulItems: silicone bread mat, baking tray (30 x 40 cm), plate, baking paper, oven
title: Pull-apart sunshine bread

ingredients.content: 150 g cheddar cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
100 g rindless bacon rashers, cut into pieces (3 cm - see Tip)
2 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
350 g self-raising flour, plus extra for dusting

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 190°C. Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place cheese, bacon and parsley into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer half of the mixture onto a plate and set aside.
Add flour, butter, salt and pepper and mix <b>4 sec/speed 7<b>.

Add milk and mix <b>15 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer dough onto a silicone bread mat or lightly floured work surface and shape into a ball. Roll into a log (approx. 30 cm). Cut log into 15 pieces (approx. 2 cm). Press 1 cut surface of each piece of dough into reserved cheese mixture and place, cheese side up, side by side onto prepared baking tray in a circle. Sprinkle with any remaining cheese mixture.
Bake for 20 minutes (190°C), until golden brown. Bread is best served warm on the day of baking.

hintsAndTricks: For a vegetarian option, omit the bacon. You can add chopped spring onions/shallots, sun-dried tomatoes or use herbs of choice in this recipe.
